body:
There is a demo on CodePen: https://codepen.io/plainheart/pen/JjGWeav
It's working well, I can't reproduce it.
3Q

> @liulinboyi Would you mind providing a test case for this?

@plainheart Test case is done, Please help review, thanks!

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. ğŸ‰
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! ğŸµ

Thanks, it's working well ! According to me it might be explained in a clearer way in the doc because I though that this option will only trigger tooltip with "showTip" and "hideTip" methods call and I wanted to trigger tooltip by methods and by mouse events also.
Anyway thanks for the answer
Thanks for your contribution, this bug has been fixed by #12762 .

```
chartOptions.tooltip.position = (point, params, dom: HTMLElement) => {
      const hideDom = () => {
        dom.style.display = 'none'
        dom.removeEventListener('mouseleave', hideDom)
      }
      dom.addEventListener('mouseleave', hideDom)
}
```

It would be better if some examples can be provided on https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html or https://codepen.io/.

I've got the same question, I had a solution to support ribbon chord.

you could import chord after import echarts:
`import * as echarts from 'echarts';
import 'echarts/lib/chart/chord'`
 but there is anther question I met, the tooltips was gone.

@albacoretuna Thanks for asking. We are discussing these kind of things on the mailing list.
For 5.0, it's available at [here](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r0cc1ead9c131031fc18fc10ff7a7a7ffa0718c5bd5b226d70e9ee192%40%3Cdev.echarts.apache.org%3E).
You may participate by sending an email reply.

If you are interested in this kind of discussions, please [subscribe the mailing list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html) for future topics.
@vishalprajapati7072 Please provide a demo for us to better understand.
@vishalprajapati7072 Please provide a demo for the issue either with https://codepen.io/Ovilia/pen/dyYWXWM or https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html.

I'm working on it with our next big release 5.0. Related: #5971

For now, you may use `label.formatter` to check if it's a certain hour (like 0:00) and add date information in the formatter.
@540548050 Please provide a demo for the issue either with https://codepen.io/Ovilia/pen/dyYWXWM or https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html.
I tried to search in the mailing list archives but I failed to find that one. Thanks a lot.
I think is a urgent feature. Switches given langFI or langDE without building echarts. There is a var lang sadly without a interface.
@JSchmidt63 I agree this needs to be resolved, but for you own benefit we managed by using https://www.npmjs.com/package/patch-package
Could you provide me an code example?

filterMode does not work for me either.

Also, this workaround might not always answer the need. One may want to filter on the serie and not on the marks.

The way I found a markArea would stick is by setting xAxis only (or yAxis only), or to also set x or y as a percentage which is inconvenient as it refers the pixels on the screen not the chart axis. All my other attempts to set both width and height resulted in the markArea disappearing.
